title: [BUG] The version of the native libSkiaSharp library (116.0) is incompatible with this version of SkiaSharp.
body:
### Description

The version of the native libSkiaSharp library (116.0) is incompatible with this version of SkiaSharp. Supported versions of the native libSkiaSharp library are in the range [88.1, 89.0)

### Code

```
Stream GenerateQr(string text)
{
    using var generator = new QRCodeGenerator();

    // Generate QrCode
    var qr = generator.CreateQrCode(text, ECCLevel.L);

    // Render to canvas
    var info = new SKImageInfo(512, 512);
    using var surface = SKSurface.Create(info);
    var canvas = surface.Canvas;
    canvas.Render(qr, info.Width, info.Height);

    // Output to Stream -> File
    using var image = surface.Snapshot();
    using var data = image.Encode(SKEncodedImageFormat.Png, 100);

    var img = SKImage.FromPixels(image.PeekPixels());
    // encode the image (defaults to PNG)
    var encoded = image.Encode();
    // get a stream over the encoded data
    return encoded.AsStream();

}
```

### Expected Behavior

**WORKING VERSION 2.88.9**

`<PackageReference Include="SkiaSharp.NativeAssets.Linux.NoDependencies" Version="2.88.9" />`

### Actual Behavior

_No response_

### Version of SkiaSharp

3.116.0 (Current)

### Last Known Good Version of SkiaSharp

2.88.9 (Previous)

### IDE / Editor

Visual Studio (Windows)

### Platform / Operating System

Linux

### Platform / Operating System Version

Distributor ID: Debian
Description:    Debian GNU/Linux 12 (bookworm)
Release:        12
Codename:       bookworm

### Devices

_No response_

### Relevant Screenshots

_No response_

### Relevant Log Output

```shell
System.TypeInitializationException: The type initializer for 'SkiaSharp.SKObject' threw an exception.
       ---> System.InvalidOperationException: The version of the native libSkiaSharp library (116.0) is incompatible with this version of SkiaSharp. Supported versions of the native libSkiaSharp library are in the range [88.1, 89.0).
         at SkiaSharp.SkiaSharpVersion.CheckNativeLibraryCompatible(Version minSupported, Version current, Boolean throwIfIncompatible)
         at SkiaSharp.SkiaSharpVersion.CheckNativeLibraryCompatible(Boolean throwIfIncompatible)
         at SkiaSharp.SKObject..cctor()
         --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
         at SkiaSharp.SKObject..ctor(IntPtr handle, Boolean owns)
         at SkiaSharp.SKSurface..ctor(IntPtr h, Boolean owns)
         at SkiaSharp.SKSurface.GetObject(IntPtr handle)
         at SkiaSharp.SKSurface.Create(SKImageInfo info, Int32 rowBytes, SKSurfaceProperties props)
         at SkiaSharp.SKSurface.Create(SKImageInfo info)
```


### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
Did you update all the SkiaSharp nugets to the same version?

The error is saying you have an old native assets in your project, but a new SkiaSharp.

comments.author: bautistavirchar
comments.body:
@mattleibow 

only this library SkiaSharp.NativeAssets.Linux.NoDependencies which the working version is 2.88.9

comments.author: elr0berto
comments.body: Got same problem. solved by downgrading to 2.88.9

comments.author: penihel
comments.body: i have the same problem

comments.author: gktval
comments.body: Same issue. I have SkiaSharp and SkiaSharp.View.Blazor. The nugets in the solution were all updated to 3.116.1. The fix was to clean the solution and rebuild.

comments.author: danilobreda
comments.body:
**116**(3.116.1) is bugged. only **88**(2.88.9) and **89**(does not exist) is working.
The check occurs on SkiaSharp.SkiaSharpVersion.CheckNativeLibraryCompatible

Working:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/65f0e018-6fa4-4081-8e9d-a4207cd7fa46)

comments.author: vadimart92
comments.body:
Seems like problem is only with SkiaSharp.NativeAssets.Linux.NoDependencies:
```
/runtimes/linux-x64/native$ readelf -d libSkiaSharp.so

Dynamic section at offset 0x8c6a60 contains 33 entries:
  Tag        Type                         Name/Value
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libpthread.so.0]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libfontconfig.so.1]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libdl.so.2]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libm.so.6]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libc.so.6]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [ld-linux-x86-64.so.2]
 0x000000000000000e (SONAME)             Library soname: [libSkiaSharp.so.88.1.0] <----
```
SkiaSharp.NativeAssets.Linux works
```
/runtimes/linux-x64/native$ readelf -d libSkiaSharp.so

Dynamic section at offset 0x891a30 contains 33 entries:
  Tag        Type                         Name/Value
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libpthread.so.0]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libfontconfig.so.1]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libdl.so.2]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libm.so.6]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libc.so.6]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [ld-linux-x86-64.so.2]
 0x000000000000000e (SONAME)             Library soname: [libSkiaSharp.so.118.0.0] <----
```

comments.author: TheFerrango
comments.body: The same problem happens under a Windows OS when the application is being served via IIS

comments.author: vikher
comments.body:
@mattleibow  I’m working on a .NET MAUI app with `<MauiVersion>9.0.50</MauiVersion>`. The app targets both Android and iOS. When using the following SkiaSharp packages, everything works fine on both platforms:

```
<PackageReference Include="SkiaSharp" Version="2.88.9" />
<PackageReference Include="SkiaSharp.Views" Version="2.88.9" />
<PackageReference Include="SkiaSharp.Views.Maui.Controls" Version="2.88.9" />
```

However, when I update these packages to the latest versions:

```
<PackageReference Include="SkiaSharp" Version="3.116.1" />
<PackageReference Include="SkiaSharp.Views" Version="3.116.1" />
<PackageReference Include="SkiaSharp.Views.Maui.Controls" Version="3.116.1" />
```

The app continues to work on Android but fails on iOS with the following exception:

```
System.TypeInitializationException: The type initializer for 'SkiaSharp.SKObject' threw an exception.
 ---> System.InvalidOperationException: The version of the native libSkiaSharp library (88.1) is incompatible with this version of SkiaSharp. Supported versions of the native libSkiaSharp library are in the range [116.0, 117.0).
   at SkiaSharp.SkiaSharpVersion.CheckNativeLibraryCompatible(Version minSupported, Version current, Boolean throwIfIncompatible)
   at SkiaSharp.SkiaSharpVersion.CheckNativeLibraryCompatible(Boolean throwIfIncompatible)
   at SkiaSharp.SKObject..cctor()
   --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
   at SkiaSharp.SKSurface..ctor(IntPtr h, Boolean owns)
   at SkiaSharp.SKSurface.GetObject(IntPtr handle)
   at SkiaSharp.SKSurface.Create(SKImageInfo info, IntPtr pixels, Int32 rowBytes, SKSurfaceReleaseDelegate releaseProc, Object context, SKSurfaceProperties props)
   at SkiaSharp.SKSurface.Create(SKImageInfo info, IntPtr pixels, Int32 rowBytes)
   at SkiaSharp.Views.iOS.SKCGSurfaceFactory.CreateSurface(CGRect contentsBounds, NFloat scale, SKImageInfo& info)
   at SkiaSharp.Views.iOS.SKCanvasView.Draw(CGRect rect)
   at UIKit.UIApplication.UIApplicationMain(Int32 argc, String[] argv, IntPtr principalClassName, IntPtr delegateClassName)
   at UIKit.UIApplication.Main(String[] args, Type principalClass, Type delegateClass)
   at Mobile.Program.Main(String[] args) in /Users/victorsanchez/Mobile-Maui/Mobile/Platforms/iOS/Program.cs:line 12
```

It seems the native `libSkiaSharp` library on iOS remains at version 88.1, which is incompatible with SkiaSharp 3.116.1 (expecting 116.0–117.0). This issue doesn’t occur on Android. Has anyone encountered this with .NET MAUI 9.0.50 on iOS, or is there a known fix to ensure the correct native library version is used?

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
Could you attach a binlog?

If you clean and rebuild, does it go away? What about building on the CLI?

comments.author: ladeak
comments.body: @bautistavirchar could you confirm if this is going to be part of an upcoming release, or closed with a different reason? Did you use some sort of a workaround?

Cleaning/rebuilding does not help.

comments.author: gktval
comments.body: I mentioned above to clean and rebuild. But I rolled back yesterday after testing 3.118.2 to 2.88.9 and had a similar issue. It kept trying to reference 3.118. I had to delete the bin/obj folders to finally get rid of all references in iOS.

comments.author: jacobilsoe
comments.body: Deleting those folders helped. Thanks.

comments.author: lilleyd
comments.body: I am also facing this issue on iOS, Is there a new release soon ?

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: Did you delete the bin and obj? If that is helping, this may be an issue in the iOS build so please open an issue with repro steps for the iOS team:  http://github.com/dotnet/macios

comments.author: penihel
comments.body: i still have the same problem yet, i have deleted the bin and obj, the problem continues

comments.author: lilleyd
comments.body: I also have tired that and the Problem Remained

comments.author: slackerbob
comments.body:
I can confirm this is still happening on ArchLinux with 3.116.1 and should not be closed.

Downgrading to 2.88.9 is the only fix I've found, but isn't sustainable long-term.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: Can you try the latest preview as well as attach a sample project repo?

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
Can you attach a binlog of the build? Did you try removing the app from the device?

Are you building on mac or using pair to Mac or the iPhone plugged into the windows machine?

comments.author: chrisw-n
comments.body:
Hi,
 Have been following this for a while as we had the same issue. Turns out that one of our other dependencies, in our case Aspose used the old version of SkiaSharp so even when we updated the native assets we still go this error.
 Aspose recently updated to the new version and now everything is good for us. Just something more to check ;)

comments.author: FreakyAli
comments.body: @vikher  I can still see this with versions you mentioned, did you ever find a fix for it?

comments.author: DiPiVR
comments.body:
For people ending up here googling: I encountered this issue when I installed `Avalonia.Svg.Skia 11.3.0` package into desktop app on linux, the workaround is installing `SkiaSharp.NativeAssets.Linux 3.116.1` to force the compatible version of `libSkiaSharp`.

```
System.TypeInitializationException: The type initializer for 'SkiaSharp.SKFontManager' threw an exception.
 ---> System.TypeInitializationException: The type initializer for 'SkiaSharp.SKObject' threw an exception.
 ---> System.InvalidOperationException: The version of the native libSkiaSharp library (88.1) is incompatible with this version of SkiaSharp. Supported versions of the native libSkiaSharp library are in the range [116.0, 117.0).
   at SkiaSharp.SkiaSharpVersion.CheckNativeLibraryCompatible(Version minSupported, Version current, Boolean throwIfIncompatible)
   at SkiaSharp.SkiaSharpVersion.CheckNativeLibraryCompatible(Boolean throwIfIncompatible)
   at SkiaSharp.SKObject..cctor()
   --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
   at SkiaSharp.SKObject..ctor(IntPtr handle, Boolean owns)
   at SkiaSharp.SKFontManager..ctor(IntPtr handle, Boolean owns)
   at SkiaSharp.SKFontManager.SKFontManagerStatic..ctor(IntPtr x)
   at SkiaSharp.SKFontManager..cctor()
   --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
   at SkiaSharp.SKFontManager.get_Default()
   at Avalonia.Skia.FontManagerImpl..ctor()
   at Avalonia.Skia.SkiaPlatform.Initialize(SkiaOptions options)
   at Avalonia.SkiaApplicationExtensions.<>c.<UseSkia>b__0_0()
   at Avalonia.AppBuilder.SetupUnsafe()
   at Avalonia.AppBuilder.Setup()
   at Avalonia.AppBuilder.SetupWithLifetime(IApplicationLifetime lifetime)
   at Avalonia.ClassicDesktopStyleApplicationLifetimeExtensions.StartWithClassicDesktopLifetime(AppBuilder builder, String[] args, Action`1 lifetimeBuilder)
   at DiPi.Speaker.Program.Main(String[] args) in /home/dipi/Documents/dotnet/DiPi.StreamApps/DiPi.Speaker/Program.cs:line 14
```

comments.author: eddieyanez
comments.body: In case anyone lands here with an issue **in iOS** after updating to the latest version 3.119.0, try deleting the obj + bin folders and restoring the nugget packages. This worked for me.

comments.author: juanpgarces
comments.body: Is there an actual fix for this yet? Why is it closed?

comments.author: molesmoke
Gabriel-T-G
comments.body:
> In case anyone lands here with an issue **in iOS** after updating to the latest version 3.119.0, try deleting the obj + bin folders and restoring the nugget packages. This worked for me.

This worked for me too. The app was running on Ios simulator, but crashed on start on my Ipad. After deleing the 2 folder , restore and debug again the app started on my Ipad too. Thanks for the suggestion.
